title: Paul Delaney (hurler)
text:
Paul Delaney (born November 1966) is an Irish retired <a href="hurling">hurler</a> His <a href="National%20Hurling%20League">league</a> and <a href="All-Ireland%20Senior%20Hurling%20Championship">championship</a> career with the <a href="Tipperary%20GAA">Tipperary</a> senior team spanned eleven seasons from 1986 to 1997.
Delaney first appeared for the <a href="Roscrea%20GAA">Roscrea</a> club at juvenile and underage levels, before eventually joining the club's senior team, however, he ended his career without a <a href="Tipperary%20Senior%20Hurling%20Championship">county championship</a> medal.
Delaney made his debut on the inter-county scene when he was selected for the Tipperary minor team in 1984. He enjoyed one unsuccessful championship seasons with the minor team before subsequently joining the under-21 team with whom he won an <a href="All-Ireland%20Under-21%20Hurling%20Championship">All-Ireland</a> medal with in 1985. Delaney made his senior debut during the <a href="1986-87%20National%20Hurling%20League">1986-87 league</a>. The highlight of his eleven year senior career came in 1991 when he won his sole <a href="All-Ireland%20Senior%20Hurling%20Championship">All-Ireland</a> medal. Delaney also won five <a href="Munster%20Senior%20Hurling%20Championship">Munster</a> medals and one <a href="National%20Hurling%20League">National League</a> medal.
After being chosen on the <a href="Munster%20GAA">Munster</a> inter-provincial team for the first time in 1987, Ryan was an automatic choice on the starting fifteen for a number of years. During that time he won one <a href="Railway%20Cup">Railway Cup</a> medal.
He is a keen Manchester United supporter and has travelled to Old Trafford on many occasions.
Paul also considers himself a golfer and plays at his local club in Roscrea.
